ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُدَّثِّرُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: You who are enveloped in your cloak!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: O YOU ENFOLDED in your mantle (of reform),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: O you enveloped in your cloak!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: O the Cloaked One! (Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: O thou shrouded in thy mantle,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: O thou enveloped in thy cloak,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: O, you, wrapped in your cloak,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: O you wrapped up in your mantle!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: O thou wrapped up (in the mantle)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: O you who covers himself [with a garment],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:1] O you enveloped in your mantle, the Prophet (s) (al-muddaththir is actually al-mutadaththir, but the tā’ has been assimilated with the dāl) that is to say, the one who is enwrapped in his clothes when the Revelation [Gabriel] comes down on him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (O thou enveloped in your cloak): '(O thou enveloped in your cloak) addressing the Prophet (pbuh) who had enveloped himself in his cloak to sleep
